Former French president François Hollande: 'Trump's plan reduces Europe's role to a besieged bystander'
byline: Interview by Ariane Chemin and Thomas Wieder
subhed: In an interview with Le Monde, the former French president argued that 'for Trump, our continent is finished, it no longer counts,' and warned that if Zelensky 'falls, it is our own security that will be compromised. Sooner or later, we too will fall.'

title: The French far right and the 'enemies within'

Sudan army chief slams Quad truce proposal as 'worst yet'
subhed: Sudan's army chief said that the proposal sent by the US envoy on behalf of mediators was the 'worst yet,' insisting that the only acceptable peace deal would include a total retreat of the RSF, who would be confined to specific areas.

title: Pope calls on kidnappers in Nigeria to free 265 students and teachers after some pupils escape
subhed: A total of 253 schoolchildren and 12 teachers are still being held by the kidnappers. Pope Leo XIV stated during mass on Sunday: 'I make a heartfelt appeal for the immediate release of the hostages and urge the competent authorities to take appropriate and timely decisions to ensure their release.'

title: Victor Hugo's interior architecture on display in Paris
subhed: The Maison de Victor Hugo on Place des Vosges unveils a lesser-known side of the writer's life with 'Hugo the decorator,' an exhibition that reveals the creativity he poured into designing his own homes.

title: Niklas Frank, a son consumed by hatred for his Nazi father
subhed: Niklas Frank, an 86-year-old former journalist, is known in Germany for his absolute loathing of his father. As a Reich official, Hans Frank, appointed by Hitler in Poland, was among those sentenced to death at the Nuremberg trials, which began 80 years ago.

title: Ukraine's Pokrovsk faces fierce fighting, footage analyzed by Le Monde reveals
byline: By Alexandre Horn, Gabriel Lecointre (edit), Elisa Bellanger (motion design) and Sinead McCausland
subhed: The major city in the Donbas faces the threat of falling after a slow encirclement by Russian forces. It would be a militarily costly victory, but one that could bolster Vladimir Putin's claims over the region.

title: The ambiguities of the 'Generation Z' movement in Mexico
subhed: Driven by a billionaire at odds with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum's government, a movement calling itself 'Generation Z' brought tens of thousands of people together for a protest against insecurity and corruption on November 15 in Mexico City, ending in violent clashes with the police.

title: As elections approach, French politicians are increasingly addicted to polls
subhed: Weakened political parties are getting more and more tempted to let opinion polls decide between candidates rather than organizing primary elections. But polling data doesn't always get everything right.
